meanings.definition: To state or declare in excess of the truth
meanings.sent1: She outstated the number of cookies she ate to avoid getting in trouble.
meanings.sent2: The weather forecast outstated the actual amount of rainfall we received.
meanings.sent3: He outstated his height on the dating profile, making him seem taller than he really was.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement outstated her actual experience at the amusement park.
meanings.sent5: The politician's promises outstated his ability to deliver on them.

meanings.definition: To surpass in stating or declaring
meanings.sent1: The singer outstated her previous performance with an outstanding rendition of the national anthem.
meanings.sent2: His presentation outstated all the others in terms of creativity and engagement.
meanings.sent3: The cat outstated the dog in the race to the food bowl.
meanings.sent4: The student's artwork outstated the rest of the class with its intricate details.
meanings.sent5: The athlete outstated his own record in the final sprint of the race.

meanings.definition: To exceed in stating or declaring
meanings.sent1: The sales report outstated the company's projected earnings for the quarter.
meanings.sent2: Her enthusiasm outstated her actual knowledge on the subject during the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The chef outstated the recommended amount of seasoning in the recipe, resulting in a very salty dish.
meanings.sent4: The author's description of the setting outstated the reader's imagination, bringing the scene to life.
meanings.sent5: The student's excuse for being late outstated any previous excuses heard by the teacher.
